longDescription.intro: In 2024 my partner in crime and I created a website for my friend and artist Helene Volle.
longDescription.motivation: My friend was in 2024 to apply to a master in a crossfield between art and biology in Italy. She started creating a website using a drag-and-drop system for a webhosted portfolio where she could display her art. While the design was good it was not how she visioned it, and in an visit she asked if I knew how to use drag-and-drop systems. I asked if my partner and I could code her website instead, and she agreed.
longDescription.process:
This application had a timeframe, as Helene needed it finished in order to apply to the collage. This made us decide to use vanilla code as I was more familiar with this, not having learned react yet. 
 The page contains ...

projects.title: LetThemCook
projects.shortDescription: School project using React and MongoDB

longDescription.intro: This project was one of two projects in the course Webutvikling. The hosted link is hidden for anyone without ntnu vpn.
longDescription.motivation: This site is a Recipe site where the user can
longDescription.process:
In our application the user can find food recipes. The user can select categories and the page will filter the displayed recipes based on this. Additionaly, the user can sort recipes alphabetically ascending or descending. It also has a randomizer button that takes the user to a random recipe, to give the user some inspiration as to what to cook. 
 The application also has a search function, that searches based on the user's input in the search field. The search function has its own page, to separate it from other filters and sorting to make it look cleaner and easier to use. Sorting search results alphabetically or filtering based on category would not lead to the best results for the user, as they already get the most relevant data at the top from their search input. This would not be the case anymore after sorting or filtering.
futureAdditions: Host the project on my own link
Have fallback data while the backend is not hosted

projects.title: Shoppinglist
projects.shortDescription: A way to avoid buying too much milk

longDescription.intro: This is supposed to be a regular shopping list where multiple users can sync their needs together so that it is easier to shop and not get multiple items of the same product.
longDescription.motivation: My partner and I have this shoppinglist on our counter that contains what we need. After we returned home one day, we found we both had been to the store without talking to the other and bought Milk. My partner is Lactose intolerant, so we get different Milk, and ended up having 4 * 1.75L Milk. This was simply too much milk, and it gave me the idea to create a synched shopping list for us. Well I know others have made this before...but what is the fun in using other peoples work?
longDescription.process: This idea was born on a workshop event that I attended created by Bekk

longDescription.intro: A website for Henriette Sandven and her book Diagnosefellen. The site collects and organizes relevant content—podcasts, lectures, interviews, articles, and other appearances—so it’s easy to find, share, and keep updated. It also includes a booking form to contact Henriette by email for events.
longDescription.motivation: All links and information needs to be collected in a single page. This also will have a booking form that connects to mail. The client does not want an admin site, as she feels technology.
futureAdditions: Booking security with focus on security from hate mail
